metadata.Title: CVE-2018-14653 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The Gluster file system through versions 4.1.4 and 3.12 is vulnerable to a heap-based buffer overflow in the '__server_getspec' function via the 'gf_getspec_req' RPC message. A remote authenticated attacker could exploit this to cause a denial of service or other potential unspecified impact. It was discovered that GlusterFS incorrectly handled RPC requests. A remote authenticated attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service or other unspecified impact.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-14653` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

glusterfs-client - 3.7.6-1ubuntu1+esm1
glusterfs-common - 3.7.6-1ubuntu1+esm1
glusterfs-server - 3.7.6-1ubuntu1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: glusterfs package in esm-apps/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.7.6-1ubuntu1+esm1').
